Reviews.Title: Great Hardware, Horrible App store!
Reviews.Author: Christopher Shively
Reviews.Content: Hardware is great! Very light, great screen, good battery life. OS & Web browser is good. App store is awful!!!!!!!!!! If you get this tablet with plans to use it to entertain your child(ren) Disney or Disney JR apps are not available in the app store. No Google Chromecast. The child or toddler apps I did download would freeze, not only the app but also the tablet! Also they would have annoying advertisements in the middle of use of the app and the "X" to close the ad would never be in one place. So my 3 year old son would hand me the tablet every time an ad came up so I could close it for him. This got pretty annoying! After a few days of using it, I just found myself not happy with it. I decide to reluctantly returned it. This device has so much promise. All it needs is a suitable app store. I guess I'm going to pay $200 more for and Ipad which I didn't want to do in the first place. Amazon you need to fix your App store

Reviews.Title: Great Small Tablet; Love It!
Reviews.Author: Music fan
Reviews.Content: I have the original Kindle Fire which I have really enjoyed.  Also have a full-size iPad which is a great size for watching movies in bed, but really too big/heavy to play games.  The original Kindle Fire has only 8 GB storage (partly taken up by software) so I wanted another smaller tablet.  It was between the new Kindle HDX or the new iPad mini.  One thing I didn't like about the iPad mini (besides the price tag) is that the bezzle on the long sides is so narrow, it is hard to hold the device without getting your thumb on the display (which screws up games).  When I saw the HDX on sale on Cyber Monday, I grabbed it.It's fast, thin, light and easy to hold for long periods of time.  I can't believe how light it is compared to my KFire! There are several design changes, such as the ability to show the percentage the battery is charged in the little icon in the top right corner. You have to swipe down from the top of the display to access settings and other utilities.  I got the 32 GB version, so there is plenty of room for games and other apps.  I did download a Prime Instant Video to watch off-line, but I don't like the small display for watching movies.About that display -- I compared the HDX to the original Fire, looking at the same page of a book that has alot of white space on it.  White is a color, and like all colors, it can be "warm" or "cool."  A cool white is "bluish", and a warm white will be a little yellowish.  When I compared the 2 kindle displays for a book, I was shocked to see something I never noticed before.  On the original Fire, the white is "cool/bluish" and there is yellowish tint seeping in around the edges of the pages of the book I was comparing!  This never bothered  me; as I said, I never noticed it.  On the new HDX, the opposite is true --  the color white is warm (yellowish) with the blue/purple (that so many have commented about) seeping in around the edges of the book.  I doubt that this will bother me, and I feel that the people who complained about this and sent back this beautiful little device because of it, need to get a life!  BTW, the page on the HDX doesn't look yellowish to me at all; it is only when compared side-by-side to the original Fire that you can detect the different tints to the white color.I love playing games on the HDX, as even fast running games (such as my favorite Temple Run 2) work without stalling.  And, I got Temple Run Oz (finally) which was not compatible with the original Fire.There are some design features I don't like, such as the way the charger sticks in at an angle.  But charging is very fast using the included charger. My only real issue now is the battery life.  I am currently charging it up, and I am going to see if I can get anything close to 10 hours of "mixed use" on it.  (Yes, there are ways to extend battery life, such as turning off wifi when not using it.  Search on the internet for other tips.)Edit about battery life:  I usually find that when products are advertised as "up to X hours on a single battery charge (depending on settings, usage, blah blah blah)"  I usually get half that. What concerned me about the HDX was that I had fallen asleep with the HDX unplugged, watching a PREVIOUSLY DOWNLOADED movie (a 2.5 hour movie downloaded in "better" quality; after it finished, the display went into sleep mode)-- the next morning, the battery was showing only 35% charged from fully charged the night before.  Since many people posting on the forums with battery problems were told to do a "hard reboot"  I tried that then fully charged the battery again (luckily, charging is pretty quick.)  Downloading music, and letting the display go to sleep mode, the HDX lost only about 10% per hour.  But as soon as I picked it up and played some games for a little while (like Temple Run 2) the battery much more rapidly depleted (this is with wifi turned on, as music was simultaneously downloading).  Then I recharged it, and again tested that same 2.5 hour previously downloaded movie -- with wifi turned off, "airplane mode" turned on, and brightness set at about 70%, the battery drained from fully charged to 65%. So, finally, I downloaded a 2 hour SD quality movie to my HDX, and going from fully charged, with wifi off, and brightness lowered to about 50%, the battery went to 88%, losing only 12%.  Yes, a big improvement over my original KFire which lost double that, 25%, under the same conditions.When I got my HDX it was about 70% charged.  Looking in the settings, I saw that the software was up-to-date.  I was able to download content, read, and play games, without the HDX turning itself off and rebooting (as many have complained of).  The next morning, I saw a notification that there had been a software update -- one thing that was changed is that you can now put apps and books into "collections."  Not only that, but apparently my HDX "synced" wirelessly with my iPad Kindle reading app, where I had already put some books into collections.  Those same books now appear in collections on my HDX without my doing anything. Thank you Amazon.I give this 5 stars, certainly in comparison to the original Kindle Fire.  In general, this HDX is spectacular and the price is great.

Reviews.Title: bargain despite the blue
Reviews.Author: Marcus L. Weiss
Reviews.Content: Must first acknowledge the 'blue thing...'  Yes--blue borders.  I have grown to find them perfectly fine.  It is just a slight blue haze at the borders--when displaying white--of the screen.  I got used to them very quickly and now actually kind of like them when I (rarely) notice them at all.  If you must read with a white background (sepia or black is easier on the eyes in any case) then this might not be the machine for you.  But for everyone else--where you gonna go?  Every single tablet has some issue--the nexus 7 has little power, the big ipad is overpriced, the little one is both overpriced and under-powered, the big hdx is much less capable as it has the same power components but needs to display all that extra space.If you can deal with the 'blue thing' and get around the 'mojito' by well circulated means--this thing is a wonderful bargain.  Sound, power, silly-pretty display, feel...and did I mention power???

Reviews.Title: Is it worth it to upgrade from Kindle Fire to Kindle Fire HDX?
Reviews.Author: RusselCornelson
Reviews.Content: I figured I would make this an ongoing review.DAY ONE - ObservationsPACKAGING: was appropriately sized;  the kindle was well protected and had no noticeable defects/scratches or damage in transit.  The kindle came to me holding a charge so I could instantaneously turn it on and play with it.  Brownie point #1SIZE: It is significantly lighter than my original fire,  and the tapered edges make it feel quite thin.  Not a fan of the tapered edges at this point,  seems slippery like I am going to drop it.  Might just be the way I hold it ..CHARGER:  I am not a fan of the charger port location;  due to the tapered edges ... the mini-USB plug goes in on a weird angle.  Can't just hold the thing flat and push it in ... I can see I will need to be very careful when plugging it in.SCREEN:  Turning on the HDX ... had a instant WOW factor.  The screen is so much better than my original fire it is almost ridiculous to compare the two.  Very crisp, clear picture and ...TOUCH RESPONSE:  I am sure it's due to the power behind it (CPU) that the responsiveness of the touch screen and smooth scrolling are also massive improvements over my original kindle.SETUP:  It took no time at all to setup;  it linked all my old books and apps automatically.  It was seemless .. my old kindle was still warm sitting beside me and I already had this one up and running with all my usual apps on it. Well done AmazonBROWSING SPEED:  One of the most improved aspects I notice is how fast the browsing of the web is.  This is something I used to not use on my original kindle ... If I had to goto a webpage I pulled out the laptop, not anymore .. the HDX is very responsive and fast,  I may argue it's faster than my viao with an i7 processor and 8Gb ram ... well at least when it comes to Browsing the web.FIRST NIGHT READING EXPERIENCE:  I found an auto brightness setting which is awesome;  lights go out, screen dims automatically.I'll update more after I get to play with it more.

I have the older Kindle Fire for quite a while now and did not experience anything like these from the older unit.

Reviews.Title: I Love the HDX Kindle!!!!

Reviews.Title: 10/10 would buy again

Reviews.Title: Great product!! iPad mini rival for sure!!
Reviews.Author: Katia Zahn
Reviews.Content: Great product!! Quad core processor screams along and runs any app perfectly! Better deal than an iPad mini for sure!

Reviews.Title: The value and quality of the 7" Kindle Fire HDX can't be beat
Reviews.Author: carpenocturne
Reviews.Content: In the tablet market, you can't beat the value regarding price on the Kindle Fire HDX. The picture quality is excellent and is perfect for viewing movies, videos and pictures. I do a lot of reading and the screen is perfect for that too. Combine all of this with the vast selections of Amazon.com and you have a near perfect device for all of your portable entertainment needs. There aren't as many app choices as Apple but all the most in demand apps are available and I've already gotten many of them. All apps, videos, music and books open and close very quickly. The only drawback I can see for some people is that you can't change the lock screen picture on your own without rooting your Kindle which I will not do but this isn't important to me. There is a revolving series of programmed pictures on the lock screen which also shows the time, and the home screen is solid black.

Given that I had previously strongly considered purchasing a Kindle, this was a disappointing and frustrating ordeal.However, I give this review an extra star for the excellent help provided to me via MayDay in trying to troubleshoot my device.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Donna Braxton
Reviews.Content: I love the Kindle Fire! The colors are vibrant and clear, and the programs are user friendly. My granddaughter also enjoys it, and I don't have to worry about what she might get into with the kids programming. My biggest problem is getting it away from her so that I can use it!

Reviews.Title: This is an awesome tablet
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: it is the best tablet around. only draw back is the one camera, hard to take good pics. Get one today

Reviews.Title: Excellent device
Reviews.Author: John Wuk
Reviews.Content: Works flawlessly.  Extremely fast WiFi connection.  Screen is top notch.  Light weight and great size for travel.  Easy to sideload apps.  Waiting for PS 4 to be added so I can try second screen.  Connects so much faster than my laptop find myself using it for most of my browsing.

Reviews.Title: Awesome tablet for the price
Reviews.Author: Melanie
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice tablet for the price and my Grandchildren love it too! Very kid friendly! They are each getting their own for Christmas!

Reviews.Title: I threw my Xyborg out after trying this.
Reviews.Author: Marge90601 "Dog Lover"
Reviews.Content: Fast to connect to wifi, responsive keypad and screen, extra features not available on other wifi tablets, ads not intrusive, haven't even started enjoying all the features. But as soon as I started it up and got on my email, I got rid of my Motorola Xyborg which was very unresponsive, difficult to type on, hard to connect with.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire 7" HDX
Reviews.Author: Marianne Nyberg
Reviews.Content: Love the new kindle HDX.  Clarity is very sharp although still a little hard to read in the sun.  (Maybe too sharp).  Still learning all the functions.  Wish there was a way to down load a full manual, vs sections at a time.Hard to sync pictures from an android phone.Not as easy to find the prime books and movies available, but with the help of the mayday button, you easily learn.Glad I up graded.

Reviews.Title: Fun to Use
Reviews.Author: NW "Beachlady"
Reviews.Content: Fun to use, fairly powerful, but has locked up on me a few times.  Hopefully locking up won't happen again.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy
Reviews.Author: Richard Eller
Reviews.Content: This probably is the best deal out there. It's the perfect size to be really something you can slip in your pocket or with a nice protective cover take along with you since it's smaller than a paperback. The display is awesome! The images are just like being there. The sound is great, but I wish there was a little more volume on the hi side. I got the 32GB with WI-FI only and all I can say is the competition really needs to look at what you can achieve for an economical price. I like how it automatically updates the software without having to search for it, and MAYDAY is just one of the most fantastic features, no one has anything like this. I had just bought a e-ink reader about three weeks before buying the Kindle Fire. All I can say, is, it's worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: Great for wireless display!
Reviews.Author: dchickles
Reviews.Content: Great little device for the price. Works perfectly for watching amazon videos on TV (in conjunction with my Netgear PTV3000)

Reviews.Title: Wonderful item
Reviews.Author: GENE
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful item. I have only scratched the surface of using it. The help button is ideal when I get stuck on something. Amazon has a winner here.

Reviews.Title: Gift for brother
Reviews.Author: Sebastian Perez
Reviews.Content: This was a gift for my brother. He loves to read. He love the easy way you can buy books to read.

Reviews.Title: I would recommend the Kindle fire HDX
Reviews.Author: austin gabhart
Reviews.Content: My Kindle fire is awesome ,picture is crisp and clear, I have watched movies on it and stereo sound is unbelievable. My wife bought an iPad and my Kindle fire HDX has a much better display , it has a ,quad core processor it's very quick on the Internet, playing games .. It does have one fault it only has a front facing camera, other than that if you're looking for a lightweight very fast excellent display tablet you can't go wrong with this

Reviews.Title: mayday is great
Reviews.Author: Melissa
Reviews.Content: love it - just wish the sharing library was more liberal with # of times you can share a book.  MAYDAY is great

Reviews.Title: Why I like the kindle Fire HDX
Reviews.Author: Ryan J.Kontny
Reviews.Content: The Kindle fire HDX is better than my old kindle fire. I like the Mayday button the advisor helped me turn off the screen reader feature. When I turned it on by mistake.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HDX Is Awesome
Reviews.Author: Prairie
Reviews.Content: This is my first experience with the Kindle Fire and I was really surprised how much I can do with it. I thought Kindle's were just for reading books or playing games but it is so much more than that.

Reviews.Title: i love it.
Reviews.Author: lindsay
Reviews.Content: i love this tablet. the mayday button is a great thing for a Luddite. i still have not figured out all the bellsand whistles but i like what i have so far.

Reviews.Title: Another step of improvement
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: This is the third Kindle and second Kindle Fire I have owned.  The HDX is even sharper than the HD is.

Reviews.Title: Great machine, enable Hulu with the Silk browser.
Reviews.Author: lancebenton
Reviews.Content: Great machine.  I bought this and my wife has a Kindle Fire HD.  We also subscribe to Amazon Prime.  My squawk is that the Silk browser does not work with Hulu (previews only) and they want you to subscribe to Hulu plus.  Amazon prime offers lots of great free streaming programs but for Hulu programming I have to go back to my laptop and just use the regular web browser to go to Hulu.com  Maybe enable Hulu if you subscribe to Amazon Prime?  r/LOB

Reviews.Title: Kindle HDX are great
Reviews.Author: Goldfinger
Reviews.Content: love my Kindle, the picture quality is great; however the internet is not the greatest. I did not buy it for the internet so I would have to say I am very pleased with my Kindle.

Reviews.Title: I enjoy the enhancements, with a few exceptions
Reviews.Author: markh
Reviews.Content: I like the display, memory and speed.While reading and charging the usb cable must come out of the top. Add on the origami stand and I can not open it like a book (right to left).Since yesterday's update the device rebooted 2 or 3 times in 10 minutes while reading.This also places the light sensor were my hand swipe hovers causing backlight to dim.The volume does not APPEAR as loud as the fire hd-7.The battery life is definitely 10-20% shorter than the fire hd-7.Looking forward to loading it up with prime videos offline...8D

Reviews.Title: This is great, perfect for the traveler...
Reviews.Author: Bonnie J. Seagroves
Reviews.Content: This is a GREAT tablet!  I had been debating whether to purchase something like this for years.  I am not someone who goes out and buys the latest and greatest- I keep things until they no longer work.  Last year I purchased a Kindle fire for my granddaughter who is 9, and I had the chance to use it a couple of times... This one has better picture and better sound.  It is a basic model- perfect for the person who travels and needs to check email, read, play games, and watch movies/listen to music.  I am in love with this and will keep it until it dies, just like my disc walkman!

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Colors and Great Book Reader and E mail Function
Reviews.Author: dennis
Reviews.Content: I purchased for my wife, who at 69, is not a wiz and computers, no matter how long I teach her how to use it.  She did learn to sort of master the Kindle keyboard...(how hard is it to push a button to turn a page?), but could never learn how to remove the books she read from the reader (backspace)!But, she loves her new Kindle fire: the color, the finger motions, all seem to make intuitive sense to her, so the calls for help are few and far between.  The next step is for her do e mail on it and considering the issues she has had with both lap top and smaller pc; we will see.  I tried it and it is very simple and works well.  She is a single finger type artist, so the lack of physical keyboard will not be an issue.She is primarily a book reader and she loves seeing the book cover!

Reviews.Title: It's great! Fast!
Reviews.Author: C.M.
Reviews.Content: I bought this for myself as a B-Day gift and Love it! The only reason it received 4 stars is due to a kinda shorter battery life. (That is because an I pad charge lasts forever).

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HDX 7"
Reviews.Author: Phyllis Osback
Reviews.Content: I LOVE everything about it; except, the screen is very sensitive. Also, It turns and then I have to move it a lot to get it back to the way I want it.  I LOVE, LOVE, LOVE "May Day".  I originally purchased the new Nexus 7 2013 and was not happy with it at all.  I returned it and purchased the Kindle Fire HDX 7".

Reviews.Title: Great tablet for price
Reviews.Author: Richfella
Reviews.Content: I am happy with my purchase.  As someone who reads a lot of pdfs, the pdfs viewer, so far, has been flawless.  I loaded several textbooks to the cloud and read them with the doc viewer with no problems.  I will say that the feature that offers to finish your words is annoying at times, but adding words to the dictionary has improved its recognition of the jargon I use in my work.  Silk has crashed a few times, but it may be do to poorly designed websites with pop ups.  Otherwise, I have been pleased with the Kindle HDX and would recommend buying one.  I also watched Sharknado on it.  I didn't mind the small screen.

Reviews.Title: Very good upgrades for Fire
Reviews.Author: Robert Lombardo
Reviews.Content: Big improvement from the original Fire excel ant sound quick response great color,very comfortable watching movies.I quite enjoy listening to my music on cloud every night

Reviews.Title: My second kindle.
Reviews.Author: Lori A. Brown "labrown"
Reviews.Content: Just got it within a week and a half ago. Still learning about what it can do. Love it so far.

Reviews.Title: love the upgrade
Reviews.Author: larryl
Reviews.Content: I have the kindle fire hd from last year and bought the hdx from best buy because it was on sell. I wasn't going to upgrade until I experienced it at the store. I thought surely this demo unit can't be how the real one is. I was wrong. I have an iPad 4 (work provided), Motorola Xoom, galaxy tab 2, original kindle fire, fire hd, Toshiba thrive, and now the HDX and I can say without a doubt I have never ever ever experienced a tablet this fast and smooth. The iPad is smooth but not instant. I even tried the nexus 7 at best buy and nope. I feel like the hd speakers are a little better than this, but not much. Other than that I'm extremely pleased in this device and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Mayday works and so does this tablet!
Reviews.Author: Dwight Daugherty
Reviews.Content: I have had my 7" kindle HDX for about one month.  I couldn't be more pleased.  The screen is sharp as advertised.  It is light and easy to handle.  The only drawback is the light blue border when the screen is white.  Frankly it doesn't really bother me.  I did use the May day button to remove a popup screen I kept getting.  I was answered within 30 seconds, problem fixed within 3 minutes!  Wow!!!!  I haven't encountered anything this tablet can't handle.I am very pleased and would recommend this tablet to anyone!

Reviews.Title: Worthy upgrade from the HD
Reviews.Author: C. Winton "cwinton"
Reviews.Content: My first Kindle was the electronic ink version, which had the huge advantage of running for weeks on a single charge if you turned off communications.  Over the next 4 years I purchased the Kindle Fire, the Kindle Fire HD, and now the Kindle Fire HDX (64Gb), all 7" models.  Each Fire model has been a significant improvement over its predecessor, although of course none come remotely close to the battery life of the electronic ink models.  That being said, as a reader, battery life for all the Fire models is fine for those long airplane trips, where you have the bonus of the device playing music while you read.  Other reviewers have covered battery life for those willing to watch movies on such a small screen.  Being able to mirror movies from Amazon Prime onto my TV is good enough for my purposes.So what else is noticeably improved?  First off, the HDX is noticeably thinner, lighter, and faster.  Second, if your email requires VPN, there is an integrated VPN client that is almost trivial to set up (you may have to download the Thor OS upgrade for this, I did).  The provided email app connected easily for me. and I found new versions of apps I typically use, such as ES File Explorer and a really good (free) SSH terminal emulation app that works great on the HDX.I debated long and hard as to whether an upgrade from my HD was advisable at this time, and finally decided to take the plunge.  I'm glad I did.  The HDX is living up to the hype.  I even found the help feature useful.  It connected immediately to a knowledgeable individual who pointed me to the need to upgrade the OS in order to get the VPN client.

Reviews.Title: Upgrade
Reviews.Author: Bobbe
Reviews.Content: Loved the original Kindle Fire, this one is better.  This version is faster and brighter.  I am glad I upgraded.

Reviews.Title: e
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: I am very disappointed with the new kindle fire hdx.  I've only had it a little over 3 weeks.  Since I had it.  it constantly loses my wi-fi singnal (at least 2-3 times per day). Then to get it to reconnect I have to stand right next to my router.  This has become very annoying.  The other issue I am having is random shutdowns of my kindle for no reason.  It doesn't matter if I am in the middle of something on the kindle or not.  I have contacted support about these problems.  He did everything he could to help and then said he would have to contact the managers and he would keep me posted by email.  He sent a few emails telling me he was working on the problem and the last email I received stated his superiors said I should update my kindle with the new update because it would fix my problems..  I think he had forgotten we had already checked that and my kindle was up to date.  Therefore, I am no longer receiving any more emails about this issue which means the problems are not fixed and now I don't know what to do about it.  I have had 3 other kindles prior to this and have never had a problem.  I have the kindle for reading with the keyboard, kindle 1st generation, and the kindle fire 7" hd.  The only one purchased from Amazon is the new kindle fire 7" HDX  which I was very excited to receive and now I am having these issues.  I am especially disappointed that my problems have now been written off.  I am going to contact support again to see if they can help.

Reviews.Title: great tablet
Reviews.Author: tmr
Reviews.Content: picture quality, speed, size  only thing I miss is google play store but I have that on my 10" Toshiba  thrive.

Reviews.Title: Kindle LOVE IT
Reviews.Author: Rae Jean
Reviews.Content: I love it.  This is one purchase I am glad I made.  I can check e-mails, facebook, read, play games.  LOVE IT

Reviews.Title: As versatile as a laptap or tablet.
Reviews.Author: Lorene Wilkerson
Reviews.Content: I love this because it substitutes for my laptop and is easier to carry with me in my purse.  I can receive emails and have documents sent to it which assists me at meetings.

Reviews.Title: amazingly easy to use
Reviews.Author: Jaime
Reviews.Content: Amazing! Easy to use. The colours are brilliant! I did not notice the blue tint or glow others described. Can't wait to watch more movies and tv! Great buy!

Reviews.Title: New kindle
Reviews.Author: Frank Latchford
Reviews.Content: Very nice and love it! This kindle is nicer than my old one! Much clearer especially for when I am playing my games!

Reviews.Title: Great Kindle!
Reviews.Author: Sharon Mcclellan "Garden Nana"
Reviews.Content: I really like this Kindle Fire HDX.  Great for travel.  I can access my accounts, read a book, enjoy Facebook and much, much more while traveling.  Much better than lugging around a big laptop.

Reviews.Title: Like it
Reviews.Author: Robert B. Miller
Reviews.Content: This unit is more powerful than my original Fire. I can surf the web more easily, and playing videos and music is a dream.

Reviews.Title: Apps
Reviews.Author: Joseph J DeLeone
Reviews.Content: I really like Kindle.  Some of the apps that I like have not worked. I am still learning how to utilize all it has to offer.

Reviews.Title: Like the Product But Concerned About Quality of Hardware (had to get a replacement after a week of use)
Reviews.Author: Scott Gill
Reviews.Content: I've had my Kindle HDX for about a week now, and I had to call and get a replacement today. The Kindle won't charge. It will turn on as long as it's plugged into a power source, but as soon as I unplug the device, it shuts down due to low battery. They are sending me a replacement that should be here in a couple of days, but it leaves me to question the quality of the hardware on the new Kindle, in general. I wonder what will happen six months or a year down the road with my replacement.That said, I love the product for the week that I was able to use it. Love the interface, the picture quality, and the look and feel of the device. There are a few apps that I have on my Android phone that aren't available in the Kindle App store (like ESPN Fantasy Football), but I'm sure that more apps will be added over time.In conclusion: I like the product, but I'm concerned about the quality of the device hardware.

Reviews.Title: Very good buy
Reviews.Author: goal13keep
Reviews.Content: This is a great buy for the money. Much much faster than the original Kindle Fire. It's a great size and weight, and an excellent price. Overall I'm very happy with the way it functions. My only complaint is that the app store seems to be lacking some. I haven't been able to get some of the apps that I use on my other devices. The ads that show up on the lock screen are a bit annoying, but not overtly bothersome (as soon as you unlock to get to your main screen, the ads are gone).I would recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Nice tablet - fast and high picture quality
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "shaoli"
Reviews.Content: Kindle fire hdx is a very good device. I like its wifi speed. It is faster than my iPad mini. The iPad mini paused a lot when I use it in my kitchen; the kindle fire hdx does not. Also picture quality of the kindle device is much better. It has a fluid key board too. Typing on screen is smooth and effortless. (Foreign language key board input is easy to set up.) I install apps by just searching on the internet with silk browser and install the android tablet comparable version. Of course you can go to the App Store to install apps if there are any. I have both App Store found apps and internet found apps installed. It is just like a powerful mini PC. One thing I would like to mention is that I do not see the blue edge issue at all. When I use my apps, the picture quality is superb. No distraction what so ever.

Reviews.Title: Great to have this gadget
Reviews.Author: Aldrich Farrel Saputra
Reviews.Content: Really love this kindle version, high end spec with a reasonable price. Technically speaking this was a good deal for me, the sound, the display, the reading experience is superb. even though i feel a bit frustrated with the region restriction.

Reviews.Title: laughing at auto correct!
Reviews.Author: a.seas
Reviews.Content: Love my new HDX7, camera ready,lots of fun,love the tech support , have used it  twice now! Both times the service was excellent,  And the price is great, for the HDX 7 , auto correct can get a bit annoying, but you do get good laughs from it.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Angie
Reviews.Content: So far it is great. It's a lot better on the battery life also. I like the slim design and it seems to move a lot better

Reviews.Title: My gift to my daughters
Reviews.Author: PBanks
Reviews.Content: I chose 5 stars even though in my opinion the camera should have been front and rear facing (just saying). Love the clarity of the color, you get 16 GB and the best feature is that button you can click on and you get to chat online with a qualified tech (no phone call to make; you see them, they don't see you).  I just hope my daughters feel the same way when they receive their gifts on Christmas.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic in every way!!
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love it!!  Very clear for reading, large enough screen to touch w/o hitting the wrong spaces.  The May day is awesome!!  It's wonderful to speak w/ someone who knows the devise and is instantly there to help.  No waiting for "next available" or speaking to someone in another country.  I would highly recommend this to everyone, esp. someone like myself who has trouble with technology.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful product!
Reviews.Author: My3Sons
Reviews.Content: Wonderful product! My son can't keep his hands off of it. He has found so many things to do and I'm sure there's even more that he hasn't found. His favorite is the drawing program which allows him to draw only one side while the program draws a mirror image on the other side. Great idea with the "Mayday" button Amazon! That was one of the main reasons that I purchased this version.

Reviews.Title: Great!!
Reviews.Author: J. S
Reviews.Content: I love it!! I wish there were more apps... I've been trying to read some of the magazines I subscribe, and I can only buy them from the apps offered through kindle, as opposed to adding my subscription number and getting access to them. Hopefully new apps come out soon

Reviews.Title: Great Screen Detail
Reviews.Author: D.J.B. "water man"
Reviews.Content: A pleasant improvement from the 7" Kindle HD that I sold to my brother. This 7" HDX model has a more detailed screen that makes the smaller sized screen more useful for web searches and emails.

Reviews.Title: I CAN GET TO THINGS WITHIN 1SEC
Reviews.Author: Julie
Reviews.Content: Best thing ever bigger than the iPod smaller than the iPad perfect size for my hands I can get to things within 1 sec

Reviews.Title: New Kindle Fire HDX
Reviews.Author: coulter
Reviews.Content: I have the original Kindle fire which I love but this one ....wow!!!!!  It powers up fast and I like that it will go to sleep but wakes up fast.  It move from screen to screen with the greatest of ease.  It is not hard to get around.  I just love it more!!!!!!  Sorry original kindle, but remember you were my first.  :)

Reviews.Title: my new favorite toy
Reviews.Author: AMBERISAAC55
Reviews.Content: It's wonderful haven't had any problems at all. Packaging was wonderful, was very nice and just opening my new toy was so exciteing like being a child on Christmas. I love it so much great quality but my only wish is that I wish it had the camera on the back but that's the only thing I don't like

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT
Reviews.Author: Jeannette
Reviews.Content: I love my Kindle Fire HDX. I can't really complain about it. It's a great tablet for the price you pay.

Reviews.Title: I love my Kindle Fire!
Reviews.Author: Sami B
Reviews.Content: I love my Kindle and I use it every day. I love cloud for all of my pictures. I love to be able to go from facebook or pinterest to reading my books, to playing games all in one sitting. Best toy I have. ;-)

Reviews.Title: great !!!
Reviews.Author: MIGUEL ANGEL CALLAN
Reviews.Content: Simply greatMy first kindle and I have had no problems. I recommend it strongly. No regrets at all pals

Reviews.Title: E$asy to set-up
Reviews.Author: S. TANNENBAUM
Reviews.Content: Easy to set-up and use for a novice.  Tried Android based unit & after 5 hours gave up.  This I had set-up & running within 15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: Hard to beat the price to feature ratio with this Kindle Fire HDX
Reviews.Author: KAYCEE
Reviews.Content: From its design to display to speed and functionality, Kindle Fire HDX is a very good tablet. Crystal clear HD display with the fastest processor in a tablet make it an attractive buy. A rear camera would have been superb along with a robust app library like the Google Play store. Also support for Google apps would't hurt. Great HD experience with Amazon Prime and Netflix. VUDU and other video apps need "sideloading" at the moment. Reading experience is amazing. Makes up for a great holiday gift this year.

Reviews.Title: Perfect travel companion
Reviews.Author: Jeff Fraley
Reviews.Content: I travel frequently and my wife got this for me before my last long trip.  Excellent choice for reading books and watching HD movies.

Reviews.Title: Love this Kindle
Reviews.Author: Inga
Reviews.Content: It took me a long time to make the decision to buy a Kindle and now I am so happy that I did.  I can buy books and have them immediately and can easily take my "books" with me to read anywhere.  The lighted screen is wonderful as is the size. I looked at the Kindle Fire but this model is so much more user friendly.

Reviews.Title: kindle
Reviews.Author: Zach Braniger
Reviews.Content: I love the kindle fire hdx it has a great speakers and display is awesome I hpoe other rate 5

Reviews.Title: Glad I had to wait to buy a Kindle
Reviews.Author: C. Aronson
Reviews.Content: I was going to buy a Kindle a few years back, but instead, due to finances, went with an inexpensive tablet. I am now the proud and happy owner of the Kindle Fire HDX 7" 32 GB and loving it! I love the speed with which the pages load, and the clarity of the pages is unreal! I love reading and the pages are so easy to see in any light...regular room light, dark room, and outside. Playing games that I had previously played on my old tablet is a whole new experience. The games are more vibrant, and no hesitation.I haven't used the Kindle for music yet, but based on what other have said, I am sure it will be great.I do like that they are now including the rapid charger with the Kindle, rather than having to purchase one separately. I have not had the need to use the "Mayday" button yet, but it is nice to know that it is there when I need it.I have not had this Kindle too long, but I can't find anything I don't like. Should that change, I will update this review. I also want to add that I am a Senior Citizen and want to let other Seniors know that they should not be afraid to buy a Kindle...it is so easy to set up (open box, register) and use!While I was having regrets about not buying a Kindle the first time, I am glad I had to wait because I now have one that has been improved and that I expect to have for some time.

Reviews.Title: The new Fire HDX 32 GB is AWESOME
Reviews.Author: Sara Rice
Reviews.Content: Another great Amazon Kindle Fire. Super easy to set it up.  Open the box and turn it on.  Register it and you are good to go!I purchased this as a gift and my daughter loves her new Fire HDX.  It is smaller and lighter than her previous Fire and wow it does a great job.  My daughter uses it to listen to music and read books.  It also has a great browser so it's super fast for her to search the web.  I really like how she can also watch her favorite shows and movies and with Prime it's so worth it.There are plenty of Apps and I am really impressed how fast it is.  I would consider it as a really nice tablet and for the price, you really can't beat it.

Reviews.Title: A great tablet
Reviews.Author: Sally in Colorado
Reviews.Content: This kindle fire tablet is finally really a tablet.  I love it for reading, doing email and running apps.  I am an app developer and I am have written an app for iPad, and android. So I have tried them all.  I own Samsung Tab 3, Nexus 7, 2 iPads and a kindle (1st gen). So I am very familiar with all these tablets.  I would have given it 5 stars, but the apps on iPad are better and more of them. It could also use a back camera to be competitive but I never use that anyway.  For the price, Amazon has done an excellent job on this device.  I even used the "May day" service a few times when I got it.Later:  I am finding the battery usage frustrating.  The battery doesn't last as long as my laptop.  It runs done faster than any other tablet that I own (iPad, Samsung Tab 3, Nexus 7). So I am down grading my rating.

Reviews.Title: Excellent!!
Reviews.Author: Diane
Reviews.Content: First tablet ever and I LOVE IT!! Has everything I need and more!So glad I purchased it and the price was the best! I've waited for this and couldn't be happier!

Reviews.Title: Enids review
Reviews.Author: catwalk
Reviews.Content: I find the quality of pic excellent. I love the video link to movies and television shows. I just wish there were more television shows available. The Kindle Fire HDX is easy to use. The streaming is fast.

Reviews.Title: My Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Dorothy Facklam
Reviews.Content: I love my Kindle Fire HDX. I am still learning a lot about it and how to use it. I never had a tablet before and this is nice because it is the right size to take any place with you.

Reviews.Title: Kindle hdx is easy on the eyes
Reviews.Author: J Pearson
Reviews.Content: What an awesome product.  I really enjoyed using it, but decided I preferred a regular camera & purchased the 8.9.  I returned this product. The camera on the 7" is fine for Skype, but it is very disconcerting to use it for anything else.  I previously had the ipad2.  The fire hdx turns on & starts up rather slowly.  But the quality of picture and ease in reading books creates a wondrous experience.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet
Reviews.Author: Laura Schering
Reviews.Content: Love this tablet. Has met all my ends plus. Easy to use. Very sensitive to the touch. Graphic s are clear, bright and excellent.

Reviews.Title: Good product, brilliant display, horrible charging setup.
Reviews.Author: dwaynebrady
Reviews.Content: Simply love this kindle.It's good for reading, fits into my pocket great for watching video while in bed too.The battery seems to be pretty good ( I keep it on airplane mode most of the time for reading) but the battery seems to last for 3-4 hours of video if not more.Only complaint will be the charging time and the charger they initially give you.

Reviews.Title: Enjoy my new kindle HDX
Reviews.Author: Geari Viney
Reviews.Content: Does everything I want but it did drop my email server several times and has to be reinstalled.  New Toy

Reviews.Title: Huge improvement!!!
Reviews.Author: George Lowe "B. Lowe"
Reviews.Content: Huge improvement over my 1st generation Fire. Beautiful display. Good browser. Almost comparable to wife's Ipad Mini but not quite, and a whole lot cheaper. Buy it!

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet, Love It !
Reviews.Author: S. Schuchhardt "SUZ"
Reviews.Content: This is an Awesome tablet. No complaints. I take it with me where ever I go. Use it in waiting rooms while waiting for appointments. For shopping lists, reminder notes. At home I don't have to be stuck in my office to read my email or to connect to family and friends on fb. Also use as alarm clock and time reminder so my day doesn't get way from me. I love it so much that each of my grandkids is getting one for Christmas. Shhhh don't tell.

Reviews.Title: Love My Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Eileen
Reviews.Content: Perfect size. Very user friendly. Great resolution. A bargain compared to other tablets. Very fast with quick access to the Internet. Love it!

Reviews.Title: Overall ok except for the packaging
Reviews.Author: kokfann
Reviews.Content: Overall it is a great product. I think there is not need for me to review the product here as many have done so.I do not hesitate to rate 5 stars if not for the packaging of the item. Amazon/courier service should consider to wrap the package in bubble wrap or foam. The package it receive is in a brown envelope and quite torn. Normally seller will put bubble wrap, wrapping the product to prevent damage but not for Kindle Fire HDX. It is lucky that there is no damage, but you seriously think that the courier/deliveryman will handle the item with care? Amazon (seller) please do your part and I believe us, buyers will appreciate it too and will feel relieve when unpack the package.

Reviews.Title: The Fire HDX is A Home Run
Reviews.Author: readsalot
Reviews.Content: It exceeds my expectations! I have the first generation model and loved it, but this one is a home run. Great display, very good sound, extremely easy to navigate.  I think the Mayday technicians will be like the "old" Maytag technicians, sitting around with nothing to do.There is nothing I would change on this tablet.  I use it mainly for reading, but also watch movies and surf the net and of course Skype, it does it all with excellence.

Reviews.Title: Not for Low Vision
Reviews.Author: Teacher_Lady "Teacher_Lady"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my father who has low vision. He is 89 and very active, but he is not tech savvy. I paid extra to get a Kindle that was free of ads hoping that this would make the first screen cleaner and easier for him to see but the circulating messy backgrounds do not make it any easier for him to unlock the devise. The Kindle does have a touch to speech feature that is nice once the device is open, but when it is on, unlocking the device is significantly more difficult than it should be. Once you are reading an Kindle book, or listening to an audible book, there are some nice features, but getting to these features is not easy with low vision. The only way that my dad could use this would be if I opened the device, selected the book that he wanted, set up the text for him and then handed it to him.  I was really surprised and disappointed that this device was not more accessible. We require curb-cuts on sidewalks, and braille on elevators. We should also require that the folks who make these kind of devices include useful accessibility features in their tablets.Update: I have called Amazon and directly asked them to improve the accessibility of the Kindle. I would like to encourage everyone who would like to see better accessibility features for older adults to say so in their reviews and to take off at least one star. Amazon is more likely to help out if they hear this feedback from LOTS of people. It is a great device, and lack of low vision accessibility for older adults is a problem that should be easy to fix.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing after owning an iPad
Reviews.Author: Steve Stockdale
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these for Christmas, one for me one and one as a gift, at $179. As much as I wanted to like it and use it, it's just not as convenient as the iPad. For one, getting music to it (except music purchased through Amazon) is a pain, requiring a file transfer app to copy from my iTunes library. From a usability standpoint, there are annoying compromises like: 1) I have to get my glasses and turn on a bright light to make sure I'm plugging the charger adapter in correctly, and then when I do, the connector is at an odd angle - not parallet to the unit, which makes it seem like it's less secure and more fragile; 2) the switch from portrait to landscape is sluggish; 3) having the power and volume controls on the underside are really inconvenient if you want to use it as a music play. The picture is great, but the Amazon-specific OS is a baffling decision by Amazon and indicates their priority is not user experience but on their ability to control the user's experience. The lack of apps and the quality of the apps is disappointing - still haven't been able to get the DirecTV remote app and the Chromecast app to work on the Kindle Fire HDX, whereas I have no problem with the apps on my iPad 2. The Kindle Fire is a perfect example of where comparing hardware for portable devices makes little sense unless you consider the entire functional experience with apps, controls, displays, menus, etc. In this respect Kindle falls short, IMO.

Reviews.Title: Older Versions are BETTER
Reviews.Author: Shelly
Reviews.Content: I like the new Kindle BUT the OLDER versions are much better. You can no longer use a HDMI device to stream to your TV. You now must purchase an additional product from amazon at a cost of around $100.  I had hoped to use the device in my classroom and didn't even think to look if they changed this capability. If I had known I wouldn't have purchased this product.

Reviews.Title: Completely Self-Indulgent Purchase - Absolutely Delightful
Reviews.Author: Byzantine Dixie
Reviews.Content: I have been straddling the Apple / Android fence for a while now, with one foot in both camps.  But the time came to declare allegiance.  Music and video purchases are less and less dependent on hard media like CDs and DVDs and are becoming more and more cloud based.  Which cloud…that was the decision to make.So Amazon came out with fireTV…and I took the plunge and decide to go with Amazon for my video purchases.  I have been a prime member since its inception…and it is the first place I go to when I am looking to buy something.  I love Amazon…probably in an unwholesome way.With that decision behind me I was now free to find a device to take entertainment with me when I travel for work.  Do you have any idea how long and painful it can be to copy DVDs into digital files to take along when traveling…I simply did not have the patience to convert all 14 seasons Dallas!  I needed a device that would hold a number of videos to get me through at least 2 weeks overseas at a time.  Reliable streaming overseas is generally not an option for a variety of reasons.And so I bought a Kindle FireHDX (64MB, no ads) and have been absolutely delighted…I seriously couldn’t be happier.  It is so FAST…compared to my android ASUS transformer tablet.  The video quality is beautiful.  The sound is great and it is extremely simple to download videos…even Prime videos…to take along on my travels.Of course, nothing is perfect.  There are some disappointments but they are relatively minor.1) Battery life is disappointing if wifi is not disabled.  That has been my experience.  I will lose 15 – 20% overnight if I leave the wifi on.  With the wifi off…battery life is very good.  If there is an option to turn off wifi after being asleep for a while…I don’t know about it yet.  Long term, hopefully something like this will be developed in a software update.2) Lack of a mini HDMI out.  I like to plug my device into the HDMI ports of hotel TVs and watch my shows from the bigger screen.  When I realized too late that it had no HDMI out, I bought a Tronsmart miracast device.  It will work but not as smoothly or easily as a simple cable would.  I think the miracast is not quite ready for prime time yet.  It is not the end of the world if I can’t hook up the hotel TV.  Watching directly from the Kindle works well.3) Apps…need more.  I once had a Blackberry Playbook.  What awesome tablet that was…really.  Fine quality device, perfect in every way…except for the limited number of apps.  Amazon has to make this a priority.  And the apps need to work beautifully…like they do on my iPhone (see, I said I had one foot in both camps!)4) Flicker.  I notice a disturbing flicker with one of my apps.  Haven’t let determined if this is strictly a single app issue or if it will show up elsewhere.  I’ll update later if it is more than just this one app.All in all I feel this was a most self-indulgent purchase…it is such a sweet device and the perfect travel companion.  (Don’t tell my husband!)

Reviews.Title: kindle fire 7 Quit working
Reviews.Author: Roy Cooper
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my wife and have had it maybe month and everything stopped working can not even unlock screen when you reset it.

Reviews.Title: Easy To Use
Reviews.Author: Big Momma
Reviews.Content: Loved it! It took a minute but I caught on to it. Smooth operation of software and other functions. The input buttons are on an angle and it's a bit different plugging cords in. I'm used to a home or wake up button. I don't like to take my kindle fire HDX 7 outside the protective case just to get it going again. I wonder if the power button is gonna eventually wear out.

Reviews.Title: Happier Than a Child at Christmas!
Reviews.Author: Moosie
Reviews.Content: Oh My God!  I LOVE this Kindle.  This replaced my old Kindle Keyboard.  I didn't realize I was living in the dinosaur age with that until I bought this new one.  I wanted to treat myself to an early birthday present.  Amazon really pulled out all the stops with this one!  I'm so proud of this Kindle.It does just about everything a computer can do.  The colors, graphics are awesome!  Games on this Kindle HDX device are so vivid, clear and work flawlessly.  I love having access to my music, the downloads are faster and easier.  I downloaded a classical music radio app, and I am so pleased with this app.  I also love reading my books on it, the screen is easier to see, looks better.I am so happy with this purchase.  This thing is so precious to me.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Khnet
Reviews.Content: Fantastic tablet, great for kids too. I love the kindle free time features and limits you can set. Easy access and fun to play with

Reviews.Title: Blue haze is very distracting
Reviews.Author: RandomReader
Reviews.Content: Please be aware of the blue haze on the border of the screen.  According to Amazon the haze is an unavoidable side effect of the screen architecture, meaning it can't be fixed.  If you use any app with a white background (books, web, etc) this will become an unacceptable distraction.Other than that the device is great. One fatal flaw, however, still spells doom.

Reviews.Title: Overall: Below Expectations
Reviews.Author: CD
Reviews.Content: Admittedly, I purchased this because of price. As my first pseudo-Android tablet, I found it to be a very limited tablet based on Apps available and limitations on installing true Android apps, including a real internet browser.Battery life for active use seems to be as-advertised; however I do not expect the batteries to fully drain while in sleep mode - this is the case with my unit.Screen quality is superb for a 7" tablet - the blue-haze issue on the borders is somewhat annoying when reading books.  Sound quality is second to none when compared to my other tablets.  Mayday is a cool feature - in a couple of instances I received great support and help; in others, it was anything but helpful.I am not a Prime subscriber - even that has limitations over other alternative media providers. This further convinced me not to subscribe.Overall, my disappointment stems from the limitation enforced with the Android apps available (c'mon, no YouTube or real Browser?), the questionable battery life when not in use, and the blue haze of this otherwise great display.Finally, I saw a recent TV ad comparing the HDX to an iPad... If anything, that ad is pushing me AWAY from any future Kindle purchases - you truly get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: love it.
Reviews.Author: justin
Reviews.Content: My family and I.own an iPad air, three kindles, several iPhones... you get the point.  For the money, this is far and away the one I consider the best.  Other tablets have their points, but this little guy does everything I can throw at it and more.  Unless you plan on dropping a ton of cash, the fire HDX can't be beat.Only issue I've had with it is I wish the kindle app.store was as extensive as their competitors.

Reviews.Title: Great technology, poor marketing
Reviews.Author: Victoria Hudson
Reviews.Content: The device worked right out of the box. Screen quality is stunning and video amazing. With the origami case there is some heft to the device and over time a unsupported hand holding it would tire. The origami case is a creative solution that works fairly well as a functional case btw. The help capability to instantly video chat with a tech is a positive experience. My Kindle arrived with special offers enabled, though I'd ordered without them. An email to customer support resulted in a reply within a couple hours, on Christmas Eve no less, with the sponsored ads removed, no charge. Incidentally, I think it would be useful if there was a way to opt back in for that content in order to receive the special offers in an unobtrusive manner. If this was controllable by the user that might be useful.I rate the poor marketing due to the following information in the product description: "Stay productive on the go with ultra-fast web browsing, built-in OfficeSuite, and updated e-mail and calendar support for Gmail, Outlook, and more"There is no built-in OfficeSuite. There is a built-in VIEWER.  A viewer is a very different product from an office suite. One can read documents but not be very productive if unable to produce documents, spreadsheets or presentations. This in my mind is just false and misleading advertising. A deciding factor in purchasing this product was the presence of a built-in office suite tool. You won't even know this either, unless you go looking on the product forum, as I and others have done, posting "where is the built-in OfficeSuite? That should tell Amazon something - consumers are expecting a true suite of office tools. Either include one or more accurately portray what is on board.I chose this device after one too many crashes with my first gen iPad. So far, I'm happy with the technology. It's intuitive, easy to use and the images on the screen are exceedingly clear and sharp. Set-up was easy and fast. The very simple on board customer service is in strong contrast to getting help from Apple, which is no where near as easy. That's a definite positive factor for this product. I do not however like a leading advertised facet of the product to turn out as misleading particularly when that facet is what helped me decide to give this alternative technology a try.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: GCP
Reviews.Content: Bought this as a christsmas gift.  So far we love it!  Was very easy to set up and start using immediatly.

Reviews.Title: Sweet!!!
Reviews.Author: Tim Whippo
Reviews.Content: I upgraded from the original Kindle Fire.Compared to the original Kindle Fire, the HDX 7" is noticeably lighter and easier to hold.The quad core processor is very, very fastHDX display is awesome!!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire 7" HDX problems
Reviews.Author: June Wiatroski
Reviews.Content: I received my kindle HDX on 12/11/13. I have called 4 times with freezing problems.  lcons that were deleted still appeared on home screen .  I spoke to  tech who was hard to understand. After close to an hour,  I requested to talk to a manager. I had to go back to factory default. For a new Kindle  I should not have to do this and freezing problems should not be happening.If this continues I want a new Kindle 7" HDX.review written 12/22/13

Reviews.Title: Perfect tablet except for google integration
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This tablet is the best 7" tablet available.  Its lighter and the battery lasts longer than the new nexus 7 and I personally think the screen has better color reproduction and contrast.  I had both and compared side by side, the Kindle was just all around better.  HOWEVER, no access to google voice, hangouts, maps, Music, keep, gmail, docs, google calendar, and chrome makes this tablet limited in its awesomeness.  I use a laptop for most of my internet and "productivity" related tasks so no integration with the google ecosystem isn't a deal breaker for me.  But it sure would be nice to be able to have hangouts, keep, maps, and voice.  Almost 100% of my IMing happens in hangouts or facebook chat, neither of which are in the Amazon market, and I would love to check my texts with google voice on the tablet.  No gmail, chrome, docs, or calendar isn't a big deal because the substitutes they have are good enough, and no music is understandable because Amazon has their own music app BUT for light social applications and looking at Maps I really wish amazon would make a deal with Google or create  decent native apps that integrates with them.With that being said, I still like the HDX 7" better than the nexus 7 tablet because of the seamless integration with the amazon ecosystem and amazing access to content through prime. Its so easy to watch movies, play games, read comics, and read books that what little leisure time I have is spent within the amazon ecosystem.  Movie/television integration is easier and more convenient than netflix on android and books look as good as they can on a tablet.  Great product!

Reviews.Title: I recommend this highly to everyone for every need and want :)
Reviews.Author: Debbie "Let your smile change the world, not ...
Reviews.Content: I teach computers and tech to people with different needs and I haven't found anyone that this isn't the perfect answer :)  So far I have 4 clients and 3 family members I have "convinced" to get one.  I only wish I had one too :)  My turn will come soon I know it will :)  Maybe Amazon will give me a credit for all the Fires I help sell and I will buy one with that :)  So just incase let them know my review helped you decide :)  I am kidding :)  only about the credit.  I am very serious about how wonderful the Fire is and how useful it is for just about everything and everyone :)  Please ask questions before buying to make sure because you want to be so happy when the box arrives that it makes you so excited for at least a month or two :) :) :)

Reviews.Title: Totally recommend!
Reviews.Author: wcfbrat
Reviews.Content: I had the first generation kindle and loved it.  I chose this new kindle because of its weight and battery life expectancy and I have not been disappointed.  The visual display is so clear and the criticism of the blue tinge on the outskirts of the display screen is not noticeable and does not take away the reading pleasure.  Overall, I am totally satisfied with this product and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Great updated Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Jean Farmer "gizzmogeek"
Reviews.Content: Replaced an original generation Kindle Fire with the new HDX Kindle Fire and it's awesome. Faster, brighter, better picture. Nothing to complain about. Worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: Mayday!
Reviews.Author: Kris Cantu
Reviews.Content: For those of you that haven't had to use the new Mayday feature know that it is awesome.  I got my KF HDX today and had a couple account registration issues to sort out.  I went into the help feature and next thing I know their was real live person on a mini "skype" screen who walked me through what I needed to do.  She could even "highlight and circle" where I needed to go to do it.  Way cool!

Reviews.Title: Deal breaker issues
Reviews.Author: boomer
Reviews.Content: I've had two HDX 7s in a week, and they both exhibit three issues that I can't overlook.1) blue light bleeding - for me too distracting in web pages, reading, etc. I can't train myself to ignore it2) wifi - I have two access points in my house, and the Fire can't hold a signal. 90% of the time I have to turn my wifi off then on to rejoin my network3) battery drain in standby. Maybe related to wifi hunting, but leaving device in standby all day drains my battery from 100% to 40% in about 10 hrsI wanted to like this for the screen, simplicity, and Prime features, but in the end, I'll try the nexus or just default to the mini.

Reviews.Title: No HDMI mini Connection!
Reviews.Author: DaMann4u
Reviews.Content: Before I tell why I gave this three stars you most understand that this is my fourth kindle and my third kindle fire hd and my first kindle HDX so I have some history with Amazon kindle products. The reason why I moved to the HDX is because I needed I much bigger hard drive. My other kindle fires are 16 gb and they became to small very quickly when I started storing HD movies. A major draw back and disappointment for the HDX is that you cannot connect a hdmi mini cable to it and watch on a bigger television. No HDMI mini connection. That's a bummer!

Reviews.Title: AWESOME!!
Reviews.Author: S. E. Hochstetler
Reviews.Content: love, love, love my hdx. I have the kindle keyboard, i have the kindle fire and now i have the hdx. the grapics are great! it is faster, lighter. It has some great new features like mayday and mirror...

Reviews.Title: Disappointing when compared to past Kindle Fire's and the current crop of 7-inch Tablets
Reviews.Author: Ken Z. "kzVegas"
Reviews.Content: Like other reviewers I'm a heavy tablet user and I can setup several tablets next to one another to compare strengths and weaknesses.  I have currently:1.) Kindle Fire (1st Gen.)2.) Kindle Fire HD 8.3 (2nd Gen.)3.) Kindle Fire HDX (3rd Gen Fire)4.) iPad Air  (5th Gen iPad)5.) iPad Mini with Retina Display (2nd Gen iPad Mini)6.) Google Nexus 7 (2013)7.) Nvidia Shield8.) ASUS Transformer TF-101First, let me say I think the Kindle Fire platform is really nice when compared to the straight-up Google android experience.  Amazon does a great job of bridging the technical gaps for a user wanting to use a tablet and not have to constantly enter their email and password.  The Amazon docs, photos, music and video compare better in use to Apple's iCloud experience and makes the Amazon prime a solid investment.  Additionally, the horsepower of the Kindle HDX is amazing and makes this tablet for the holiday 2013 season a solid gaming platform.  My own benchmarking of the Kindle Fire HDX shows that gaming performance and CPU performance place this unit within the same performance bracket as the current generation of iPads and the Nvidia sheild.  Which is saying something when the HDX is half the cost of an iPad mini and 2/3rds the cost of a Nvidia shield.My disappointment comes from the screen on the Kindle fire HDX.  The HDX's screen shows a very visible and noticeable blue ring around the display's edge.  I've measured the blue ring to be one-eighth of inch along the long edges of the screen and slightly less on the short edges of the screen.  These blue edges really become notable when you are reading a book or browsing a web page that have white page backgrounds.  The blue ringing is much less noticeable when viewing the carousel page (which are grey) or running a app that uses something darker around the edges.I can not recommend the Kindle Fire HDX to my friends, family and colleagues because of what I consider to be design defect in the screen.  This blue ring is not apparent on either my Kindle Fire or Kindle Fire HD 8.9 or other tablets that I have.

Reviews.Title: Best Tablet Ever!!!!
Reviews.Author: janell2012np
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love my new Kindle Fire HDX! It's the most amazing tablet ever. The mayday feature is a lifesaver. And you barely have to wait for someone to help you. The person is nice, but the better part is that they actually know what they are doing. I wouldn't trade my Kindle in the world! I always carry it with me!

Reviews.Title: Great tablet for the price
Reviews.Author: Andrew V.
Reviews.Content: The only negative I've found after 4 days use is the inability to play Flash video.  Unfortunately Adobe no longer offers Flash Player for Android.

Reviews.Title: No HDMI or USB Hosting
Reviews.Author: Derick
Reviews.Content: Great screen, fast and responsive.  The new features in the Mojito OS are terrific additions and make owning a Kindle Fire much more rewarding.  Its everything you could want out of a tablet...except for two things.There's no HDMI port.  It didn't even occur to me to look for this, the old Kindle Fire HD has it, so I guess I thought it would be a given.  Instead it relies on Miracast.  Miracast is supposed to be like a wireless HDMI standard, but you have to buy a $50+ device to make it work.  The other thing missing from this is USB hosting, which is present in every Android 3.1+ device.  I wanted to use my Kindle Fire HDX to upload photos from my camera to Facebook and the like while I was out on vacation by using a Micro USB SD Card Reader.The no HDMI thing doesn't bug me as much as the USB thing, I really wanted to be able to look at my vacation photos on my Kindle Fire HDX while I was out on vacation.  To be honest, if I hadn't bought this on Cyber Monday I would be returning it for a Nexus 7 for just this one thing.  Maybe its a software limitation that Amazon can fix, I don't know, but I hope it is, and they do indeed fix it.

Reviews.Title: Regarding Blue Light.....
Reviews.Author: Scott
Reviews.Content: Regarding blue light........I poured through all the reviews on this device, so I was well aware of the negativity surrounding the blue light used in the Kindle.  I would say this:  If your intended use of this device is to read Kindle books, I would run away.  Far away.  Go with the black&white; Kindle.  But, if you plan on doing just about anything else, the Kindle HDX is an excellent choice.  You'll never notice the blue edges, except for maybe web pages.What blew me away most about the Kindle was the sound.  I have had every iPad since day 1 and have always just accepted the speaker quality.  I'll still use my iPad simply because of all the Apps I already enjoy, but for movies and TV shows I'll go to the Kindle every time.  Amazing sound.  Why can't Apple do this with the iPad?Bottom line is:  Buy it. It is well worth the money.  I bought the one with the ads and they don't really bother me at all.  They are tailored to what you look at and or purchase on Amazon, so I don't mind that marketing approach.

Reviews.Title: Unbelievably good
Reviews.Author: Selma T. Kusuda "voracious reader"
Reviews.Content: I can't believe how good this Fire HDX is. I have the Kindle fire and this is so much better. I can do so many things that I couldn't do before. I am an elderly woman and this has made me so excited and happy.

Reviews.Title: My favorite tablet and the price is amazing.
Reviews.Author: Michael C.
Reviews.Content: I love this device so fast and so smooth my favorite tablet by far and the price is amazing! I would recommend this tablet over any other!

Reviews.Title: amazing upgrade
Reviews.Author: Heather "Heather R"
Reviews.Content: This is a million times better than the kindle fire. So much faster and lighter. Don't let the blue edging scare you. It is barely noticeable. I really would not have noticed had I not read the reviews. The display and sound are outstanding.

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet
Reviews.Author: William K.
Reviews.Content: The best tablet I've ever bought.  I've tried the Nexus and Apple iPad and those are great too, but the Kindle Fire HDX 7" is amazing.  It's a must if you're an Amazon Prime customer.  All of your media in one place and in one echo system.  I highly recommend this tablet.

Reviews.Title: Great little tablet!
Reviews.Author: Mom of 3 stinky boys! "Lindsay V."
Reviews.Content: This is a fun little tablet. There are a few pros and a few cons to it though.Pros:I like the smaller size. We also have a 10 inch tablet and this one is much easier to carry around with me.I LOVE the Free Time app for Kids. I love knowing that I can hand my tablet over to my 3 year old and he'll only be able to see and play what I approve for him. I also like that I don't have to tell him when time's up. He just hands me back the tablet and goes to play.Reading on this Kindle is so nice. I love that it holds my spot and tells me how far along I am in the book. I also like that I have access to all the books I've bought in one place. It's a lot easier to carry this around than it is to carry around a heavy book.Cons:I'm not so fond of where the power button is. It's kind of awkward to find. As well as the charging port. It's at an odd angle and I have to actually pay attention to what I'm doing when I plug it in.The apps from the Kindle store are few and far between. There aren't a whole lot of them. There are the basic ones for social networking and a few good (free) games. But I'm hoping that in the near future Amazon will come out with a lot more apps.I also wish I could add more storage space to this like the android tablets. However it's not a HUGE deal because you get storage on your cloud. Which is really nice.Overall I think this is a fun little tablet. I wish I had gotten the one without the special offers as those can get annoying but oh well. I enjoy using this tablet and so do my kids. It does pretty much everything I need a tablet to do!

Reviews.Title: Amazon hit this one out of the park.!
Reviews.Author: Joyce Scott Blessed by the best. "So Blessed."
Reviews.Content: I love this  thing! It can do all the things I like to do . The storage space through Amazon  cloud was a huge selling point.  The 7 inch screen size is ample room for me to look at things without strain. I am also very happy with the "May Day“ button and the representatives that I have talked to. A+++.  I would recommend this Kindle  to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Haven't put it down since I got it!
Reviews.Author: Christopher White
Reviews.Content: Absolutely love this tablet. If you are a prime user and into Amazon books and movies this is the tablet for you. A lot of people mentioned a blue light around the edges of the page when reading, I simply changed the background to the black with white lettering and this eliminates this and also makes it easier to read especially with no light at night.

Reviews.Title: Worth every penny
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this tablet! So easy to use, has lots of features, and the price is right. I highly recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: love it!
Reviews.Author: mon lucas
Reviews.Content: Love it !  I was waiting for the iPad Mini retina display however decide to get the Kindle fire HDX instead. Love it is better than expected. Love the May day help. The display is sharp and is very fast . if you use for Facebook, emails and shopping there is no better way to Go.  Still testing battery life .  Just wondering if I should had bought the bigger 8.9 kindle HDX. If you are member of Amazon prime don't wait . Get it now.

Reviews.Title: Good for reading, not for collections
Reviews.Author: Beate73
Reviews.Content: I've now had the new Fire HDX for a couple days, and being a now long time iPad user, it's a good alternate to iPad. There aren't as many apps for the Fire as you have for iPad, but I'm guessing that's just a matter of time before they fix that.I mainly bought the Fire so that I could add my very extensive book collection to it. For reading I've been using the Kindle Touch 3GB, and I have more books than I have space. I found it tedious having to add and delete books all the time. I thought the Fire would be a good step up.If you have a couple hundred books, the Fire is perfect for your book collection. But if you're like me, and have been using Kindle for years and have a 6K+ collection, you might be disappointed.First, you have to click on every single book to import it onto the Fire. There is no batching. I really wish they could have had an "add whole collection" option. Importing is tedious at best.Second, you can't just import your old collections and believe that all books will automatically place themselves in the correct collection. First of all, I now have collections from my very first Kindle on the Fire. A Kindle that has been deregistered from my account for ever.The collections that did import correctly, are a mess. Books are missing, or the wrong books are in the wrong collection.Then there is the books that aren't in a collection. If you're viewing your books as collections, you can't find the books that aren't in a collection. It is simply impossible to figure out which book is in a collection and which book needs to go in a collection. I like to organize my books, and collections were the perfect way to do so. On the Touch, that is. On the Fire, it's all a big pile'o'crap, and I can't figure out what's up and what's down.So far, bookwise, Fire has been a huge letdown for me. I was really excited about getting the new HDX with the 64GB hard drive, thinking I'd finally be able to put by books in order. Not so much.As far as reading experience, the Fire is very good. The screen is clear, the text easy to read, and it doesn't hurt your eyes like the iPad does. Which is the only reason I give the Fire HDX 3/5 stars. I really hope Amazon updates the OS real soon where you have the option to import your whole collection with just a few clicks. And most of all I hope they fix the collections issues. Just thinking about what a mess my Kindle is makes me want to cry.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire Is Growing Up!
Reviews.Author: JPP Smorenburg
Reviews.Content: I want to share my feelings about my new HDX 7 which I received recently. I'll update the review as I get to know the HDX as time passes. I use the HDX daily for 2 hours on average reading and surfing. I use a PaperWhite 3G at work and at home and have used previous E-ink Kindle generations for daily reading in the past. Kindle Fire is growing up fast. The vastly upgraded device response and fluidity are already well commented on. The extra speed when surfing the web and navigating the HDX are again a big step up, good work. There is very little display reflection, improving reading once again this gen. Text is totally, faultlessly sharp.A very cool software feature in the Kindle app are the extra Wikipedia and Translation boxes that come together with the dictionary definition box, totally cool. Silk works better, taking many opened tabs in its stride and making the most of the display size with the cool article mode and nicely working full screen option that takes away the tabs and adress bar to move the page upward. I always found the iPad 4:3 display ratio appealing, but the Silk features mentioned above make the 16:9 ratio enjoyable for web surfing while keeping the device as small as possible.The form factor is again much improved with the HDX generation, no apologies necessary anymore. It's much more manageable than my previous generation HD 7; noticably less circumference and a third less weight. The physical buttons are very tactical, unlike those on the previous gen., and the sometimes mentioned "angled" USB port feels and looks solid, not at all awkward. The bezels are smaller and the plastic outer enveloping rim much more so giving a very tight, high quality appearance compared to the previous gen.In my opinion, Amazon have at this generation arrived at a wonderful compromise between "boutique" (like iPad) and "utility" (previous gen. HD) moving steadily toward the iPad. Also with the HDX, there is a better compromise between Amazon presence (say, like an Amazon website-type environment) and an open Android presence (like any generic android tablet) with the HDX showing beautiful, eerily sharp lockscreen wallpapers, app icons matrix and book covers, with removable recommendations which, removed, leave an "Android or iPad like" home screen save for the background, which is (in my opinion) nicely dark with classy icon shadowing.Battery life is at least as enduring as on my previous gen. HD. Sound is as good to my ears.UPDATE:I have some clouding, showing a brighter spot of about an inch in the centre of the display, which is visible on an even background like when reading. I can only get rid of it when switching to white text on black. The slight blue border bleeding is also present, but doesn't bother me at all.UPDATE 12/3/2013: I've requested and was right away permitted after a short live chat an exchange HDX to arrive in a couple of days, amazing stuff!UPDATE 12/5/2013: I received my replacement HDX today. What a miracle of logistics; from across the Atlantic traceable almost to the hour. Even my return HDX I can track. Boggles the mind. Well, I must say the clouding is less with the new one, but I can still see it. My daughter (painter artist) shakes her head and says: "You exchanged it for that?", when I show her the "faulty" one. Must be me then. I'll accept it as a HDX character trait.UPDATE 12/14/2013:The HDX performs excellently, the smaller size and mass, and the very sharp, defined characters are more appreciated as time in use passes. The new ability to sort cloud content in collections is much appreciated. Silk occasionally froze.
